title: Pune techie attacked with billhook outside Vimannagar; accused arrested

Two men, later arrested, assaulted him due to mistaken identity, fueled by a cab driver's suspicion of a love affair. The victim sustained severe injuries, prompting calls for increased security and patrolling in the area, highlighting rising concerns about criminal activities.

title: Hyderabad murder: Man who repeatedly struck Renuka with pressure cooker arrested
content: Hyderabad police have apprehended Harsh and Roushan in Ranchi for the brutal murder of 50-year-old Renuka Agarwal at her Kukatpally flat. The attackers, who repeatedly assaulted Agarwal with a pressure cooker and stabbed her, sought access to valuables. After the murder, they stole gold and cash, changed clothes, and fled, but were traced via CCTV footage and a manpower agent.

title: Asia Cup: Tit-for-tat! After IPL franchise, now PSL team boycotts IND vs PAK

PSL franchise Karachi Kings mirrored IPL's Punjab Kings' veiled reference to Pakistan, sparking online backlash. An Indian Supreme Court plea sought to cancel the match, citing terrorism concerns and national security, but was denied an urgent hearing.

title: ‚ÄòRPM was high‚Äô: Woman describes moment Thar flew out of Delhi showroom

Despite the dramatic accident, the woman, her husband, and a showroom employee escaped with only minor injuries. The woman has since refuted rumors of serious injury or death, attributing the incident to high RPM.

title: Nano Banana trend: Turn photos into 3D figurines with Google AI Studio; 15 easy prompts
content: Google's new AI image editor, "Nano Banana," integrated into the Gemini app, allows users to effortlessly transform photos into 3D models. This tool, officially known as Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, has seen widespread adoption, with over 200 million images created or modified. Users can easily generate 3D figurines, designer pet toys, and fantasy avatars using simple text prompts.

title: Delhi riots case: Amnesty, 6 other global rights' bodies seek Umar Khalid's release
content: Amnesty International and other human rights organizations are urging the Indian government to release Umar Khalid, a former JNU student, highlighting his prolonged detention as a symbol of repression against those exercising free expression. They criticize the selective prosecution of activists opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Act while officials allegedly inciting communal tensions enjoy impunity.

title: iPhone 16 Pro Max at Rs 89,999: iPhone 16 Pro Rs 69,999; Flipkart sale deals
content: The Flipkart Big Billion Days Sale 2025 is poised to offer substantial discounts on the Apple iPhone 16 series. The iPhone 16 Pro Max could effectively start at Rs 89,999, while the iPhone 16 Pro is expected to cost Rs 69,999. The base iPhone 16 might drop to Rs 51,999, making it the most affordable.

title: 4 years' jail for AAP MLA in Dalit woman assault case
content: In a 12-year-old case, AAP MLA Manjinder Singh Lalpura from Khadoor Sahib has been sentenced to four years in prison for assault and molestation of a Dalit woman. An additional sessions judge convicted eleven individuals, including six policemen. Lalpura and six others received four-year terms, while three got one-year sentences.

title: 'New dawn for Manipur': PM Modi urges peace 'to secure children's future' ‚Äì top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi made his first visit to Manipur since the ethnic violence began, braving heavy rain to reach Churachandpur. He laid foundation stones for development projects worth ‚Çπ7,300 crore and inaugurated projects worth ‚Çπ1,200 crore. Modi emphasized Manipur's significance in the Northeast's growth, highlighting improved connectivity and infrastructure projects.

title: 'Internet disruption': Red Sea cables cut - Why it may take months to fix
content: Internet services in India, Pakistan, and the Middle East are facing disruptions due to severed undersea cables in the Red Sea. Experts attribute the damage to a commercial ship dragging its anchor. Repairing the cables could take weeks due to the limited number of specialized companies and the complex undersea operations required.

title: Airstrike on two Myanmar schools as students slept; 19 killed
content: Airstrike in Myanmar's Rakhine state killed at least 19 high school students. Twenty-two others sustained injuries. The Arakan Army reported the incident occurred in Kyauktaw township. The AA blamed the ruling military junta for the attack on private schools. UNICEF condemned the brutal attack. The strike adds to escalating violence in Rakhine.

title: UP horror: Student raped by auto driver on Yamuna E-way; accused shot in encounter
content: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly sexually assaulted by an autorickshaw driver in Mathura after she hired him from the Yamuna Expressway to reach her university. The driver deviated from the route, stopped at a deserted location, and assaulted her.

title: ‚ÄòBurnt alive over dowry‚Äô: Victim‚Äôs last words convict in-laws; UP court gives them life term
content: An Aligarh court sentenced five family members to life imprisonment for the dowry death of Neelam Bharti, who was harassed for more dowry even after her family spent Rs 20 lakh on the wedding. Before dying from being set ablaze, Neelam identified her husband, in-laws, and sister-in-law as her murderers in a dying declaration.

title: Jaguars vs FanDuel: $5M payout revealed; ex-worker scandal rocks NFL
content: Amit Patel, a former Jacksonville Jaguars finance manager, embezzled approximately $22 million from the team between 2019 and 2023, primarily using the funds for gambling on FanDuel. Following Patel's guilty plea and prison sentence, FanDuel agreed to pay the Jaguars $5 million as a partial settlement. Patel also sued FanDuel, alleging exploitation of his gambling addiction.

title: ‚ÄòDemanded job again‚Äô: Fired worker stabs Hyderabad bizman to death in full public view
content: In Hyderabad, real estate businessman Srikanth Reddy was fatally stabbed in Moulali's HB Colony on Friday. The primary suspect, Dhanraj, a former employee fired for intoxication, repeatedly sought re-employment. After receiving money for liquor, Dhanraj, along with an accomplice Daniel, returned and attacked Srikanth when his job request was denied.

title: 'Post war': Ex-Pakistan seamer reminds high stakes in India vs Pakistan match
content: The highly anticipated India-Pakistan Asia Cup 2025 clash is set for September 14 in Dubai, amidst political tensions and initial ticket sale concerns. Shoaib Akhtar dismisses unsold ticket rumors, anticipating a packed stadium due to heightened emotions. Both teams began their campaigns strongly, with Pakistan defeating Oman convincingly and India dominating UAE.

title: Shots fired outside Disha Patani's Bareilly house; Goldy Brar group claims responsibility
content: In Bareilly, unidentified assailants fired shots at Disha Patani's residence, with the Goldy Brar group, linked to Lawrence Bishnoi, claiming responsibility. The attack is suspected to be connected to a controversy involving Disha's sister, Khushboo Patani, who criticized Aniruddh Acharya for alleged misogynistic remarks. Khushboo's online video expressing her anger may have triggered the incident.

title: Asia Cup: Pakistan skipper warns India - 'we are good enough...'
content: Pakistan's captain, Salman Agha, exuded confidence in his team's ability to triumph over any opponent, including India, after their dominant 93-run victory against Oman in Dubai. This statement precedes the highly anticipated India-Pakistan clash in the Asia Cup. Agha acknowledged areas for improvement in batting but praised the outstanding bowling performance.

title: Oracle‚Äôs stock rally mints new millionaires; young techies in India reap windfalls too
content: Oracle's stock surged by 36% following multi-billion-dollar AI cloud deals, briefly making Larry Ellison the world's richest person. This rally minted hundreds of new millionaires among Oracle staff, thanks to restricted stock units. An engineer in Bengaluru now values his portfolio at Rs 1.5 crore.

title: Want to go to UAE? Don‚Äôt skip the certificate of equivalency - Here's how to apply
content: Moving to the UAE for work, study, or residency? You'll need a Certificate of Equivalency to validate your foreign degree. Issued by the Ministry of Higher Education, this document proves your qualification meets UAE standards. The process includes attestation, verification, ICA travel records, and an online application. It‚Äôs essential for jobs, university admissions, and Golden Visa eligibility.

title: Ilia Topuria: McGregor-style ambition to political tease; ‚ÄúPresident Ilia‚Äù leaves fans buzzing
content: Ilia Topuria, the current UFC lightweight champion, has addressed the possibility of entering politics, similar to Conor McGregor. While he hasn't seriously considered it, Topuria stated he wouldn't rule it out if the public desired his leadership. He also expressed confidence in defeating McGregor in his prime, highlighting the evolution of the sport.

title: Prominent figure in cricket under investigation for drink spiking, sexual assault
content: A well-known English cricket personality in his 40s is being investigated by Scotland Yard following allegations of drink spiking and sexual assault against two women in a Fulham pub in May. The Metropolitan Police interviewed the man under caution in June, but no arrests have been made.

title: Travis Kelce & Taylor Swift: Engagement buzz to fan backlash; Gaylor community divided
content: Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce has stirred a whirlwind of reactions, particularly among the 'Gaylor' fanbase, who believe Swift's public image conceals her true identity. Kelce's role has become central to discussions, with some fans questioning the authenticity of the relationship. While some express disappointment, others adopt a more nuanced perspective, acknowledging the complexities of identity and relationships.

title: 'Oppose this‚Äô: Pahalgam victim‚Äôs father reacts ahead of Ind-Pak Asia cup
content: Sanjay Dwivedi, grieving the loss of his son in the Pahalgam terror attack, is strongly against the India-Pakistan cricket match in the T20 Asia Cup. He reminded the government of their promise to cut ties after the April attack that killed 26, urging them to respect public sentiment and reconsider sports relations with Pakistan.

title: Pak military convoy attacked: Taliban ambush kills 12 soldiers in Waziristan
content: A Pakistani Taliban ambush in South Waziristan resulted in the deaths of at least 12 soldiers, marking one of the deadliest attacks in recent months. The Tehreek-e-Taliban (TTP) claimed responsibility, highlighting the intensified militant activities in the Afghanistan-Pakistan border regions since 2021.

title: Mizoram's first railway line: PM Modi inaugurates Bairabi‚ÄìSairang project
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Mizoram's first railway line, the Bairabi‚ÄìSairang broad-gauge project, a significant boost to the state's connectivity. The project, costing Rs 8,070 crore, features complex engineering, including numerous tunnels and bridges. This new line directly links Aizawl with the Indian railway network, enhancing logistics, tourism, and daily life for residents.

title: India backs UN resolution; votes for 'sovereign Palestinian state'
content: India supported a UN resolution backing the 'New York Declaration,' advocating for a peaceful resolution to the Palestine issue through a two-state solution. The resolution, adopted with 142 votes, urges collective action to end the Gaza conflict and calls on Israel to commit to a two-state solution, halt settlement activities, and end violence against Palestinians.

title: Gujarat high court finds former cricketer Yusuf Pathan guilty of land encroachment
content: The Gujarat High Court dismissed Yusuf Pathan's petition, affirming his encroachment on a 978 square metre plot owned by the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC). Despite a rejected 2014 proposal to sell him the land, Pathan retained possession.

title: Goalpost, new balls and medals: Inside India‚Äôs Asia Cup fielding session - watch
content: After the Bronco Test introduced by India's Strength and Conditioning coach Adrian Le Roux, fielding coach T Dilip has come up with a new fielding drill to enhance the ability of the Indian cricketers to cut gaps in the field.

title: 'Farce, tokenism, insult': PM Modi's Manipur visit draws Congress ire
content: Opposition leaders Mallikarjun Kharge and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra have criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Manipur visit, which occurred two years after the ethnic violence. Kharge called the visit a "farce" and a "cowardly escape," while Gandhi stated Modi should have visited "long back.

title: ‚ÄòUnqualified to be US Ambassador to India‚Äô: Ex-US NSA slams Sergio Gor's nomination
content: John Bolton has voiced strong disapproval of Sergio Gor's nomination as US Ambassador to India, citing concerns about his qualifications and understanding of international policy, particularly regarding Russian oil sanctions. Bolton also dismissed Peter Navarro's anti-India remarks, emphasizing that Navarro's views do not represent official US policy and reflect a lack of understanding of international relations.

title: Chess: Once Gukesh's Hindi translator, Divya pushes World champ off top-10 Rating
content: Gukesh Dommaraju and Divya Deshmukh, Indian chess prodigies, faced off at the FIDE Grand Swiss in Uzbekistan. Their first classical format encounter ended in a draw after a 103-move battle. Grandmaster Pravin Thipsay analysed the game, highlighting Divya's unusual opening and Gukesh's missed opportunities. With the draw, Gukesh, undergoing a slump, fell out of the top 10 in live ratings.

title: 'NE suffered due to vote bank politics': PM Modi slams Cong in Mizoram - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Bairabi-Sairang railway line in Aizawl, Mizoram, connecting the state to the rest of India. He also flagged off the inaugural Rajdhani Express to Delhi and other trains to Guwahati and Kolkata.

title: ‚ÄòWhoever the lucky person is‚Äô: Tamannaah on breakup lessons; reflects on growth as partner
content: Tamannaah Bhatia is rethinking life and love. She wants to be a great life partner. This comes after her reported breakup with Vijay Varma in early 2025. They started dating after meeting on Lust Stories 2. Tamannaah is currently promoting her new show, Do You Wanna Partner, with Diana Penty. The show premieres on September 12.

title: 'Permission leni chahiye thi': Rahul, BJP MLC argue at UP meet - watch
content: A heated exchange erupted between Rahul Gandhi and BJP minister Dinesh Pratap Singh during a Raebareli meeting. Gandhi, chairing the DISHA meet, instructed Singh to seek permission before speaking. Singh later criticized Gandhi, alleging he acted like an "owner" rather than a chair. Singh, a former Congress leader, also protested Gandhi's remarks against PM Modi's mother, demanding an apology.

title: Indian-origin man beheaded in Dallas: Nearly $200k raised for family
content: Chandra Mouli "Bob" Nagamallaiah, an Indian-origin motel manager, was fatally attacked in Dallas by Yordanis Cobos-Martinez, a Cuban national with a criminal history, after a dispute over a broken washing machine. The brutal assault, witnessed by Nagamallaiah's family, has sparked outrage and grief within the Indian-American community, prompting calls for investigations into immigration policies and national dialogue on societal violence.

title: Teair Tart fined $12,172 for slapping Travis Kelce; NFL discipline explained
content: Los Angeles Chargers DT Teair Tart was fined $12,172 for slapping Kansas City Chiefs TE Travis Kelce in Brazil. NFL rules treat open-hand contact differently from a punch, sparking Andy Reid‚Äôs frustration. Learn how the fine system works, where the money goes, and what it means ahead of the Week 15 rematch.

title: CBSE 2026: Additional subject scrapped; private candidates blindsided
content: CBSE has scrapped the additional subject option for private candidates in the 2026 board exams without prior notice, leaving thousands of students distressed. Many drop-year aspirants, who relied on this option for JEE, NEET, or career shifts, now face uncertain futures. With the September 30 deadline looming, students demand clarity as CBSE remains silent amid mounting frustration.

title: ‚ÄòYou don‚Äôt belong here‚Äô: Sikh woman raped in UK; attackers hurl racist slurs
content: In Oldbury, near Birmingham, a British Sikh woman in her 20s suffered a racially motivated sexual assault and beating by two white men. West Midlands Police are investigating the rape, which occurred on Tuesday, treating it as a hate crime due to racist remarks made during the attack.

content: Fresno State men's basketball was a team going nowhere, smack-dab in the middle of a dreadful 6-26 season in 2024-25 . they were set to host new Mexico on new year's Eve as heavy underdogs, up to 17.5 points . weaver's apparent belief that no one would notice when he placed a $50 daily fantasy bet on himself .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the 2025 WNBA playoffs open Sunday . all eight teams are in action, with the no. 1 seed Minnesota Lynx taking on the expansion franchise Golden State Valkyries . the red-hot Las Vegas Aces host the Seattle Storm .

title: 'He threw the freakin' shoe!': Revisiting Marco Wilson's infamous toss five years later
content: college football's Marco Wilson throws an LSU player's shoe in the fourth quarter of a rivalry game on Dec. 12, 2020 . the throw, which came in a tie game against a heavy underdog, certainly cost Florida a win . five years later, the play proved a turning point in the history of an once-proud Florida program .

title: Fantasy baseball news: AL West race heating up; Buehler to debut for Phillies
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the remaining 14 contests are all evening affairs . it's unclear for this evening's opener of a three-game road set with the Atlanta Braves .
